org.apache.felix.ipojo
Class Extender

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.felix.ipojo.Extender
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator, org.osgi.framework.BundleListener, org.osgi.framework.SynchronousBundleListener
public class Extender
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.osgi.framework.SynchronousBundleListener, org.osgi.framework.BundleActivator

iPOJO Extender. This class listens bundle arrivals and departures in order to detect and manage iPOJO powered bundles. This class creates factories and ask for instance creation.

Author:
Felix Project Team
See Also:
SynchronousBundleListener, BundleActivator

Field Detail

DISPATCHER_ENABLED

static boolean DISPATCHER_ENABLED
Enables the iPOJO internal dispatcher. This internal dispatcher helps the OSGi framework to support large scale applications. The internal dispatcher is disabled by default.

ENABLING_DISPATCHER

private static final java.lang.String ENABLING_DISPATCHER
Property allowing to set if the internal dispatcher is enabled or disabled. Possible value are either true or false.

See Also:

closeManagementFor

private void closeManagementFor(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
Ends the iPOJO Management for the given bundle. Generally the bundle is leaving. This method stops every factories declared is the bundle and disposed every declared instances.

Parameters:
bundle - the bundle.

startManagementFor

private void startManagementFor(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
Checks if the given bundle is an iPOJO bundle, and begin the iPOJO management is true.

Parameters:
bundle - the bundle to check.

parseAbstractFactoryType

private void parseAbstractFactoryType(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle,
                                      java.lang.String header)
Parses an IPOJO-Extension manifest header and then creates iPOJO extensions (factory types).

Parameters:
bundle - the bundle containing the header.
header - the header to parse.

parse

private void parse(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle,
                   java.lang.String components)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   ParseException
Parses the internal metadata (from the manifest (in the iPOJO-Components property)). This methods creates factories and add instances to the instance creator.

Parameters:
bundle - the owner bundle.
components - The iPOJO Header String.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the manifest can not be found
ParseException - if the parsing process failed

getIPOJOBundleContext

enablingDispatcher

private static void enablingDispatcher(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext context,
                                       Logger logger)
Enables or disables the internal dispatcher, so sets the DISPATCHER_ENABLED flag. This method checks if the ENABLING_DISPATCHER property is set to true. Otherwise, the internal dispatcher is disabled. The property can be set as a system property (ipojo.internal.dispatcher) or inside the iPOJO bundle manifest (ipojo-internal-dispatcher).

Parameters:
context - the bundle context.
logger - the logger to indicates if the internal dispatcher is set.

createAbstractFactory

private void createAbstractFactory(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle,
                                   Element metadata)
Adds a component factory to the factory list.

Parameters:
metadata - the new component metadata.
bundle - the bundle.

getBundleContext

public org.osgi.framework.BundleContext getBundleContext(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
Computes the bundle context from the bundle class by introspection.

Parameters:
bundle - the bundle.
Returns:
the bundle context object or null if not found.
